greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of entries in the k-th blocks of all set partitions of [n] when blocks are ordered by decreasing lengths (and increasing smallest elements); triangle T(n,k), n>=1, 1<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
example: so there are 10 elements in the first (largest) blocks, 4 in the second blocks and only 1 in the third blocks.
maple: b:= proc(n, l) option remember; `if`(n=0, add(l[-i]*
b:= proc(n, i, t) option remember; `if`(n=0, [1, 0], `if`(i<1, 0,
b(n-i*j, min(n-i*j, i-1), max(0, t-j))), j=0..n/i)))
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=1..n), n=1..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 02 2020
mathematica: b[n_, l_] := b[n, l] = If[n == 0, Sum[l[[-i]] x^i, {i, 1, Length[l]}], Sum[ Binomial[n-1, j-1] b[n-j, Sort[Append[l, j]]], {j, 1, n}]];
T[n_] := Function[p, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 1, n}]][b[n, {}]];
Array[T, 12] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 28 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 07 2018
